other_tests.findings: The mean follow-up was 95 months, significant recurrence of band keratopathy, ABMD, MCD, lattice dystrophy, and granular dystrophy was identified at intervals of 7.8, 12.4, 13.5, 19.7, and 23.7 months after PTK, respectively. RTVue OCT showed recurrent deposits in the anterior corneal stroma, and confocal microscopy revealed disorganized stromal fibers, decreased density and disordered arrangement of nerve fibers, and inconspicuous keratocyte nuclei.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The recurrence of corneal opacities tended to become more severe over time, with the depth and number of deposits increasing.

other_tests.findings: The recurrent deposits involved the anterior corneal stroma and were mainly located within 8 mm from the corneal center.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The depth of recurrent deposits increased over time across different conditions (e.g., 119.2 micrometers for band keratopathy, 143.8 micrometers for MCD, etc.), indicating progressive worsening.

other_tests.findings: Confocal microscopy indicated cellular alterations such as disorganized stroma fibers, decreased keratocyte density, and irregular morphology of the corneal endothelium.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No specific changes over time were detailed, but signs of altered cellular morphology frequently increased with recurrent disease.
